official-title.#text:
To require the Secretary of State to offer rewards of up to $5,000,000 for information regarding
			 the attacks on the United States diplomatic mission at Benghazi, Libya,
			 that began on September 11, 2012.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall offer a reward of not more than $5,000,000 to individuals
			 who furnish information—

text.#text: In accordance with the Rewards for Justice program authorized under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 36 of the State
			 Department Basic Authorities Act of 1956
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: State Department Basic Authorities Act of 1956/s:36

text.#text:
regarding the attacks on the United States diplomatic mission at Benghazi, Libya, that began on
			 September 11, 2012; or

leading to the capture of an individual who committed, conspired to commit, attempted to commit, or
			 aided in the commission of the attacks described in

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 4530 IH: To require the Secretary of State to offer rewards of up to $5,000,000 for information regarding the attacks on the United States diplomatic mission at Benghazi, Libya, that began on September 11, 2012.
